We‚Äôre currently staying at the Titanic Deluxe Lara, and honestly, it‚Äôs been nothing short of amazing, despite the change of rooms on the first night (it was too small). The whole place is stunning ‚Äî beautifully maintained, spotless, and full of energy. Every single member of staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome and relaxed. The highlight of our trip so far has definitely been the cabana service. Having our own private cabana by the pool has made our holiday feel truly luxurious ‚Äî comfortable loungers, chilled drinks, delicious snacks, and the most attentive staff we‚Äôve ever come across. Our cabana host H√ºseyin has been incredible, always checking in to make sure we have everything we need before we even have to ask. The food and drinks throughout the resort are top quality, with so much variety that every meal feels different. The atmosphere is perfect ‚Äî lively when you want it to be, but peaceful when you just want to unwind. Every detail here is so well thought out, and you can tell the staff genuinely care about guests having a great experience. We‚Äôve already said we‚Äôll 100% be coming back ‚Äî it‚Äôs the perfect mix of luxury, comfort, and fun. If you‚Äôre thinking about booking Titanic Deluxe Lara, don‚Äôt hesitate ‚Äî and definitely treat yourself to the cabana experience. It‚Äôs worth every penny and has made our stay unforgettable.

Currently staying here as a group of 5 adults and 2 toddlers and are utterly disappointed with the hotel. Having stayed at another hotel (Trendy Lara) in Lara Beach 3 months ago and had a great experience, we decided to push the boat out a little more for this trip as the reason for the holiday was to celebrate my Dad‚Äôs 70th Birthday which falls during the stay. We paid around ¬£400 each more for this hotel than we could have got the Trendy Lara and based on reviews we thought we were going for a more deluxe holiday experience, this has been far from the case. We arrived 10 mins after the main restaurant had closed and were made aware that we‚Äôd have to wait 1.5 hours for the midnight snack bar to open in order to have anything to eat. We had 2 hungry toddlers with us, who needed to be fed and put to bed so this was far from ideal. Having stayed at loads of all inclusive resorts all over Europe, I‚Äôve never know one not keep part of the restaurant open with a limited selection of food available for guest arriving late, even 3 star resorts offer this as standard. After some complaining, the staff agreed to arrange room service for us however, it took so long to arrive that we were only 10 mins off the snack bar opening. The hotel is generally tired and worn, in need of updating. The door to the balcony in one of our rooms is broken and coming away from the frame, letting in a draught and noise. The kids tables and chairs in the restaurant have seen much better days. Generally everything is just in need of a revamp. The staff are ‚Äúfine‚Äù, not rude for the most part (although a couple have been) but not particularly friendly either. Drinks Service and clearing tables is very slow in the main restaurant, particularly at breakfast when we‚Äôve had to go hunt down someone to place drink orders every day so far, because there is no self service option. The food is ‚Äúfine‚Äù but nothing special. All very luke warm, pretty much the same every night. Pretty standard all inclusive except that this is meant to be a 5* resort and by comparison to our experience at the other hotel a few months back, falls very short. There, we had so much more choice, so many stations where food was prepared fresh, variety from one night to the next and food was actually hot. There are a few additional options for lunch, down towards the beach. We had to queue for a while for the Italian lunch restaurant and then half the table‚Äôs food was brought over so long before the other half that they‚Äôd finished eating before the others had received theirs. The staff didn‚Äôt seem at all bothered by our frustration over this, as 3 adults had finished their food whilst 2 adults and 2 toddlers were sat waiting for theirs. There are a la carte restaurant options during the evenings, but all at a cost. The one thing they do have that exceeds our experience elsewhere is the kids club. This has been recently refurbished and includes a great soft play and lots of activity rooms, which are all very clean and full of things to keep the kids entertained. Generally, the hotel is ‚Äúfine‚Äù. Nothing at all special, no extra little bits that you‚Äôd expect from a 5* resort to elevate the experience. It is a 4* resort at best and absolutely not worth the extra money. Save your money and go to Trendy Lara or one of the other resorts in the area. We‚Äôre so gutted that we ‚Äúsplashed out‚Äù on this as a treat for a special occasion, expecting my Dad‚Äôs 70th to be something truly special, when this just won‚Äôt be the case.

As someone who is apprehensive about what I book, i can honestly say this is a beautiful hotel. There is a few points that can be worked on but I will give the good and the bad. Good :
‚Ä¢ Clean facilities, overall well maintained hotel. ‚Ä¢ Clean towels and pool towels daily. ‚Ä¢ Entertainment for children and the kids club is amazing. ‚Ä¢ Pool and loungers and high quality and lots to do by the pool. Option of relaxing areas as well as kids pools and music playing. ‚Ä¢staff by the pool on roller skates, always coming round offering drinks. ‚Ä¢drinks were nice and plenty of options. Bad :
‚Ä¢ Food choices limited - we found the buffet especially on the evening to be repetitive and poor quality of food. We really struggled with this and my partner actually felt like he was on rations. Snacks in the day are limited by the pool with only fruit, ice cream or waffles available. Jacket potato bar open 4pm-6pm. If you want nicer food the beach bars are your best bet but again limited timings for this. We really struggled with the food at this hotel. My children didn‚Äôt eat very well. ‚Ä¢waiters in the buffet were often abrupt/rude. They couldn‚Äôt speak very good English and only understood coke or tea/orange juice. They would only come to you once for a drink. I did not find them very helpful. ‚Ä¢bar waiters again were abrupt. Only the ones on the roller skates or the ones serving food I found to be polite. The waiters at the beach bars were also rude/abrupt. ‚Ä¢ storage for clothes in the rooms were very little, struggled as a family of 4 to unpack all of our clothes. There were 3 drawers and about 5 coat hangers. ‚Ä¢ I wouldn‚Äôt say there is loads to do at this hotel. Overall it is a lovely clean hotel. There is a lot that can be improved on especially when it comes to the food.

Since my review was deleted - I will reshare! Stayed at the Titanic for 2weeks - non of fell ill even though there was posts prior to our arrival ü•≥ So we had big expectation for this hotel, the price tag to this hotel as well was not cheap & we feel utterly disappointed. Where is foam parties, beach parties - theres literally nothing exciting. We were giving room 2105 "Family Room" - having that space was incredible but the music from the Titanic & Mircale Hotel going onto early hours.. Who put family rooms here? They are also not accessible even trying to get to the pool. If baby is sleep in pram you need to lift the pram up stairs to get to your room! The kids splash area was fab but take apart from that... the kids club looks great from the outside but at night time it becomes a 'cattle market' - so busy, softplay becomes very busy - bigger kids knocking the small ones over. The park is tiny and again very very busy. I personally did not like the fact the mini disco was away from the bars. All previous holidays its just beeb at the main stage, parents can watch having a drink etc. We also didn't agree that the main entertainment started at 9.45pm! By that time the kids are going off their heads cause they are tired. Trying to keep them up to see the fireworks at 9.45pm for the White Party was stresseful. Drinks were okay, the skater boys round the pool are fab. Bar staff were kind but the restaurant staff - looked like they wished they were elsewhere. Even witnessed the female manager shouting at a staff memeber during breakfast - not very professional. Few days before we were due to depart, we went for dinner. Grab one of those puff pastry deserts that had cream in between - not sure why i opened it. And it was MOULDY! I took a picture of it, showed the head chef who ripped the mould out asking what the issue was. by this point the steam out my ears was about to explode. He took me to 2 other men who wear the white tshirts, they were like where is it. I said he just ripped it out but heres a photo of it - they started talking in turkish, who knows what they were saying. They said it was cheese, i said thats no cheese thats mould from your deserts. I point over and they walked that way again speaking in turkish. So i went screw this & left. Spoke to guest relations who phoned the head chef (who btw is more interested making sure theres nothing stuck inbetween his turkish teeth) and he advised they have been removed, whether they did or not. So if anyone had puff pastry deserts with cream in the middle with blueberries or strawberries on Tues 30th Sept, youve ate mould.. Next day, went for breakfast, the eggs tasted funky, the fruit was hot, the mushrooms that sat in 'a pan' was cold even though we went at 8am for it opening... There is also pieces missing from drainage slates around the pool - while i was holding my child, i went down into one of the holes and hurt my already fractured ankle even more. (Thank you again to those who helped me btw) - spoke to guest relations, didn't care. More interested in me visiting the nurse cause thats money! So by this point I have 3days left of my holiday and i wanted to go home. This is meant to be 5* hotel premium shall we say... I have been to 4* hotels which is better than this. The hotel we went to last year in turkey, had foam parties for the kids, inflatables during the day for the kids etc and we did not want to leave. With this place, i counted the days down. We were disappointed and will never return to this hotel or recommend this. ps - place could be doing with a deep clean!

I want to share two things that made me not want to come back and that is massive use of one-time plastic and the freezing cold pools. On their webpage it says the hotel dont use one-time plastic but that is not true. I hope they can change that in the future. The pools were very cold, around 18-20 celsius would be my guess, and there were not many people using the pools compared to other hotels where families are a big customer group. In the summer with 40+ it might be nice and cooling, its the only logic to make out of it. The webpage said one pool was heatet, and inside, but not in October anyway. The kids only played in the pools for a few minutes at the time, and I saw that for other tourists as well. The pools was also not suited for children under 140 cm as that was the  lowest dept of all the pools. A tiny baby pool is there in the back, but its not at the pleasent area in the garden. The pools were very lovely though, big and nice, but the temperature made that not matter. Other wise the food was lovely, but its all inclusive which means eating with many others in a noisy room, but that is probably what you know booking this type of hotel. Rooms was lovely, and activities for the children as well. In light of the plastic frustration, some of the drinks they use in the bar to mix drinks/ smoothies are syrup and dont know what they contain, afraid its the cheapest juices one can get, fresh fruit which they had a lot of to eat, would be nice to use in drinks etc.

Our review on Titanic Deluxe Lara as a family of 2 adults 1 child 8yrs
Arrival - no welcome drink, luggage porter or assistance to room Room- good size we stayed in a family room sea view. Room was surface clean but we had to wipe down sides and bathroom again so bring antibacterial wipes. Toiletries, towels provided and changed daily. Mini bar included complimentary. Tea/coffee and kettle in room. Good size tv that you can connect firestick too so bring with you as no English channels. No iron in room and not allowed in rooms (hotel policy). Air con works well. No USB charging and only 3 sockets so bring extension lead and adaptors. Cushions and bed aren't very comfy but good size. Food- our main issue with the hotel. Food is the same every day. Food doesn't cater well to English and is very very meat heavy. Labels on Food are hit and miss and you would really struggle here with any food allergy as cross contamination and labelling is incorrect. Food always lukewarm and not rotated or managed. Nothing is cooked in front of you or too your taste. Most dishes are stew based or boiled sitting in water. We really struggled to feed our son anything whilst we were here apart from waffles and pancakes. Cats roam around restaurant and tables aren't sanitised when reset with dirty cutlery. So again bring wipes to clean your table down before eating. No sanitizer station in restaurants. Drinks are served too you at table and can take a while to be served. Al a carte serve exactly the same food that can be found in buffet restaurant. Service is better in al a carte but not worth the extra cost. Flies everywhere in restaurants. Pastry chef - nothing is cooked fresh . All pastry and cakes come in either frozen or batch baked from boxes. Only reheated or plated up here. Drinks- absolutely awful cocktails. Spirits are branded and served free hand. Efes is main beer served but if you ask at bars you can get Corona, Becks and Miller. Soft drinks are from a mixer machine that is very watery or poured out flat from 2ltr bottles. You can ask for crisps and nuts at bars. They seem to hide drinks from you and push cheaper local drinks. Coffee hut open until midday is slightly better as have full options of alternate milks and syrups. Pools- slides and kids water tower are really good. However again cleanliness around the pools is shocking. Smell of sewage especially around childrens pool and toilets are horrendous. You are provided with key cards to get fresh towels for pools each day. Beds are really comfy. Pools aren't heated apart from indoor pool. We always managed to get a bed. Drinks can be ordered to your bed via qr code. Pools sides are very slippy. We witnessed adults and children falling over. Definitely recommend swim shoes for children. Cabanas- we hired a pier cabana and really enjoyed our day. They start at ‚Ç¨150 euros -‚Ç¨300 depending on location . Service from our butler was really good. Food served is the same you get from the beach side restaurants. Kids club- recently refurbished and very good facilities including a soft play, lego room, ps5 and craft room. Air con and option to stay with child or leave with wristband. Activites throughout the day and open until midnight. Kids club restaurant has small menu, ice cream, baby food and milkshakes. Beach- lovely beach with plenty of beds and a beach bar. About a 5 min walk from main complex. Not enough options in the evening for family mainly djs or loud bands. Noise may be a problem if you want to have an early night. Hotel opposite (i think miracle hotel?)had loud music until 2am . We was up late most nights so not an issue for us. Staff- all staff are polite but do tend to serve locals before you. Location- we had private transfer and took 20 minutes from airport. Right in middle of lara beach 
You can walk into main strip in 5 minutes over the blue bridge . They accept euros , sterling and lira in shops. Facilities- hotel is over 20 years old and it does show in alot of areas. Furniture and seating well worn, decor very dated and generally dirty in need of a deep clean. The hotel has a spa and gym. Both facilities really good and look recently upgraded. Gym has air-conditioning and a good selection of free weighs and machines. Bowling bar has a bowling alley that has to be prebooked day before and pool tables. Bowling alley has no option for side barriers or ramps to help children play. Arcade room over half of the games are broken which is frustrating. Gardens are well maintained and lovely to walk around. There is not enough lifts for hotel guests and queues are frustrating especially with guests pushing in front. In hotel shops are ridiculously overpriced. Cats- cats are everywhere and freely roam around hotel and restaurants. Not something we liked or agreed with . Tripadvisor- before booking this hotel we could only see glowing reviews and what we have experienced is in no comparison at all to what we were expecting. Negative reviews are blocked or taken down. We have been asked to leave a positive review but we will be leaving a real review on TripAdvisor but imagine it won't get published. This hotel is not value for money and very overpriced. Atm we havent (touch wood) been ill but we have seen rooms being closed off and housekeeping leaving changes of laundry and towels at bedroom doors to unwell guests. And the hospital doctor is always on call visiting
guests in rooms. We have spoke to families who have colds (believe to be from air con units/pool bacteria? ) and overheard many families mentioning stomach issues. We would say this is a 3 star hotel no deluxe aspect that we experienced. Hotel is very dated in places, food is poor, cleanliness is shocking and overall experience is just ok. We have visited Turkey many times and this has been the most disappointing hotel. Our best day was out of the park at Land of Legends. We would not return and would not recommend.

Just home after 2 weeks at this hotel with family and we had a brilliant time! I have provided my honest review below‚Ä¶ This hotel should not be advertised as 5 star. A 4 star would be fair as there is room for improvements. A bit tired, in need of refurbishment. We were on the 8th floor and the furniture is a bit worn and showing signs of wear/ looks like they haven‚Äôt had anything done to them in recent years. Paint around windows and walls cracking. The shower is a good size and there was always hot water. Also glass windows to the front of the hotel are shattered half way up the building. Carpet in hallways stained. Plenty of choice in the main buffet restaurant, snack bars at lunchtime were very good. Kebabs at one and pizza and pasta at the other. We went here everyday to break up always going to the main restaurant so we didn‚Äôt get bored. Good choice of drinks, providing cans of soft drinks around the hotel and not just in the mini bar would be a good improvement. A lot of good branded drinks and beers served in bottles. Always something on to keep them entertained and felt very secure with the wristband process. We were very impressed with the kids club and the kids in our party loved it. Illness stories are true: To clear up all the feedback of people saying they were getting ill while staying here, we found this to be true. 4 of our party all had symptoms of a sickness bug - high fever, sickness, diarrhoea. Not just a bit of a bad belly this was full on sickness and a high fever with loss of appetite following it. This lasted a full day or 2 days max for each of us. I guess it‚Äôs a mix of people having a bug and spreading it through hygiene, hand sanitising stations dotted around the site would help with it being such a large hotel. Something we found annoying was one day half way through our holiday a member of staff came to us at the pool and tried to pressure us into submitting a review on trip advisor and google there and then. I don‚Äôt review until the end of my stay to give an accurate and fair feedback on my visit so this was very unprofessional and annoying. A special mention to the rollerblade guy at the Olympic pool mete I think his name was, served us well everyday and was very pleasant and hard working. Also the lady on the pool towel desk she was so friendly and cheery everyday when we met her. She made us smile every morning! All in all we had a good holiday with family but I would definitely say it is fair to say that this hotel is not 5 star and should not be advertising itself as it is until some well needed improvements are made. The price we paid per person ¬£2k for 14 nights I feel was well over what it was worth.

We have just returned from 10 days at this hotel there are some minor improvements that need to be made but on the whole we have had a great holiday. Pools - good variety and lots of space as long as you arent bothered about being right on pool side at the main pool. All pools are cold but bearable (we normally travel out of season so are used to having pools heated). The main downside is the lack of shade, we have a 3 year old and the only way we could guarentee shade without having to sit on a grassy area or having to move constantly was to pay for a cabanna. I appriciate the sun moves but I have never known it to be so difficult to maintain shade even with umbrellas. Unfortunately every so often there is a sweage smell near the main pool - very noticeable next to the bar in the shaded free cabannas on the grass which I refer to above. Paid Cabannas - these were a life saver despite me having to pay for them. We did a beach cabanna twice (front row) and pool cabanna four times. The service we recieved from the guys here was really good special mention to Aziz and Ahmet, we also had one other guy who was great but unfortunately I didnt get his name. The pool cabannas are in need of a repaint as the paint is coming off and ends up on your feet. The other thing is they are only surface cleaned we quite often noticed old empty bottles, dropped food etc under the cabannas or stickers from peoples googles left on the side. Although I am a firm believer people should clean up after themselves for the amount you pay (150euro a day) they should be cleaning these properly. The only thing I would say is more needs to be done to keep people out of the area who have not paid as unfortunately people ignore the red barriers and peoples kids seem to do as they please (appriciate this isnt down to the hotel so much but more measures to help you enjoy the cabanna without worrying about other people invading your space and then arguing when you politing ask them to leave would be helpful). I also think you should have 2 teirs of pricing to allow a cheaper option with no butler service but still use of the cabannas. Rooms - Very small for a family of 3 compared to other hotels we have been too. We really struggled getting the pram in the room and it not being in the way of a bed or the exit. Beds and pillows were uncomfortable but this is a personal preference we managed to sleep just not as well as I would have liked. Again cleanliness is surface clean my daughters feet were black from walking around the room and balcony both day one when we got here, throughout and including our final day. This again is not expected from a 5 star hotel. Drinks were always topped up well. There is also signs of wear in the room, balcony door doesnt properly lock, cracked handle for bidet, dirty curtains, peeling wallpaper. View was quite nice could see other hotels entertainment plus sea, pools, moutains and we would often watch the planes at night. Food - Buffet is plentiful for variety and hot, always staple beige food avaliable. Alot of the meat is overcooked for our taste and the food seems to be the same options daily. We did have the Asia al a carte booked but this was cancelled due to lack of other people who had booked and we also booked the steak restaurant. We very much enjoyed our t-bone steaks our only comment was it needed to be seasoned which of course we did do ourselves but would have expected it to come seasoned to taste. The beach restaurants at lunch were by far our favourite but food is very much pizza, pasta, burger and kebabs. Personally we would prefer the option of more traditional local food options avaliable. Facilities- Bowling we didnt use as the age limit was alot higher than our daughters age. Arcade is pointless as 90% of the rides/games are out of order. I would much rather have to pay for each game/ride and them all be working and maintained, than it be a free arcade and nothing works. Entertainment looked good from the snippets we saw as it was abit loud for our 3 year old. Titanic fest was really nicely catered to for kids with lots of games and inflatables. I cannot comment on the spa or gym as we didnt use it. The Hookah store is lovely and if you like your shisha the home made stuff she offers is very nice and good value. The kids club has alot of options for kids the only thing i would say is they aren't good at giving blank colouring sheets, my daughter wanted to colour a number of times and we never ended up getting a new picture for her as even when asking the staff didn't give us any and couldn't find any lying around. There is some signs of wear on some of the toys or pieces missing but this isnt unexpected. Beach - clean, safe, lots of fish. We fed the fish biscuits and watermelon from the peir a few times. Sand gets hot so recommend water shoes. Defo get a beach cabanna on front row for guarenteeed shade. Staff - all staff friendly and polite and speak good variety of languages. Life guards also really friendly and observant. Any staff selling spa treatments, cabannas, Al a cartes and even entertainment team are very respectful of a no thank you and are not in anyway pushy with getting you to spend more which is refreshing for Turkey. Lifts - absolute pain point 5 lifts for this size hotel is horrendous as they are shaped as they would be on a cruise ship (to fit the theme) they barely fit anyone in especially when cases, prams and/or inflatables are involved. Breakfast, evening after the pool (around 5/6pm) and dinner were the worst sometimes having to call the lift in excess of 10 times before we could get in. Location - close to shops, dolphinarium and bars/restaurants also on 25mins drive from Land of legends and 30mins from airport. On the whole I would recommend this hotel it does need a couple of minor improvements to reach the 5 star standard advertised and expected for the cost but it didnt particularly dampen our experience.

Beyond his skill and efficiency, it‚Äôs his personality that makes the difference. Friendly, approachable, and genuinely kind, he makes every interaction a pleasure. You can tell he truly takes pride in his work, and it shows in the way he goes above and beyond for every guest. Ey√ºp is an absolute credit to the hotel. His dedication, charm, and outstanding service turned our time by the pool into one of the highlights of our holiday. Staff like him make all the difference between a good trip and a truly memorable one.

I just wanted to write an honest review for anyone looking to book here next Summer The Good
Swift check in and luggage delivered to room on arrival - no welcome drinks available which have experienced in other 5 star hotels. The majority of the food was really good and tasty. The pools are clean and big, plenty of really good slides for children of all ages and adults. The drinks are good. Cocktails all made with branded spirits. Plenty of bottled water available all over the complex. Clean pool towels available all day. Change as many times as you like. Plenty of daily activities, darts, yoga, pool games etc if you‚Äôre into that kind of thing. Entertainment at night was good. Different shows in the amphitheater most evenings or party‚Äôs - white party, pier party also a titanic fest one evening on the football field which was full of interactive inflatables, food and even a buckeroo! The kids club is huge and did look really good it also has a little restaurant and menu just for kids. Find the ice lolly‚Äôs in here - although I did not feel comfortable leaving my 5 year old in there by himself, I just didn‚Äôt get a good vibe that he would be 100% safe in there. Especially on an evening the automatic front doors were constantly opening as it was so busy with people coming in and out. So easy for a child to escape in my opinion. The cabana‚Äôs - we hired a pool cabana on two occasions on our 10 day trip. Although these are pricy at ‚Ç¨150 for six people (extra per person for any more) - the service was outstanding and really enjoyed the space in the cabanas. The staff - they all work so hard, majority of them very friendly and cannot do enough for you. Special occasions- we had a birthday. The staff went above and beyond for this. Decorated room, our cabana had baloons and also our meal at the steak house also had baloons. We had wine fruit a birthdays card and a cake in our room. The weather was amazing! Late 30s early 40s each day. The Bad
The rooms - these are very small and cramped, furniture and decoration rather outdated, the bedding seemed damp on most days which was weird. The duvet was too small. For what we paid it was definitely not justified here. The lifts - these are an actual joke especially at busy times. We gave up on these a fair few times and took the stairs. Luckily we was on floor 3. The food / dining experience - although food very tasty it was the same thing each day. I found myself at the Indian/ Chinese/chip section most evenings. You cannot get a drink yourself. You have to wait for the staff to come and serve you. Not good when you are parched. Also having to sit at a dirty table most nights to wait for it to be reset. The complex overall is very cramped. There are a lot of people and it feels really crowded where ever you go. This was disappointing as they looked good on the pictures. The iced drinks are literally very watery iced coffee with squirts of syrup chucked in for the flavour. Ants - don‚Äôt use the subbed on the grass unless you like being bit to death by the ants!! The lunch restaurants - again good food but very long waits Snacks - not a massive selection of snacks through the day. I mean there‚Äôs only so many cakes, jacket potatoes, or waffles you can eat  no fast food huts like experienced at other 5 star hotels. The ugly
Sun beds!!! The sunbed situation is terrible. Don‚Äôt get me wrong there is always beds available somewhere on that complex but not always where you would prefer. But don‚Äôt even bother with the ones by the main pool unless you want to become involved in heated arguments almost fights with other guests who think you have stolen their beds! People get up silly hours to reserve the beds with their towels in the best locations round the main pool and then leave them and go back to bed. However little do they know guest relations comes along and remove these towels, then along come innocent people and think oh great I‚Äôve got a decent bed, to be greeted by horrible angry guests a few hours later claiming you have stolen their beds and towels. So there you go hope this helps you in deciding where to spend your hard earned money on your well earned family holiday

We travelled as a large family group in July 2025 and were initially impressed by the grand lobby, attractive grounds and multiple pools. The beach area is lovely and there‚Äôs plenty of food variety at first glance. Unfortunately, several of us became unwell during and after the stay, with one confirmed case of salmonella and others suffering stomach cramps and vomiting. We also witnessed other guests being sick around the resort and even saw a child soil the pool‚Äîonly half the pool was briefly closed, which was worrying. Our room was clean but noticeably small for a 5-star resort, leaving little space for luggage and making it feel cramped, especially with children. Service was mixed: staff were generally polite, but when we requested fresh bedding after our daughter was ill, it took a long time for housekeeping to respond. After sleepless nights caring for our poorly children, we didn‚Äôt feel like we had a holiday at all. The setting and facilities are attractive, but hygiene, food safety, and room size need serious improvement. Until these issues are addressed, I can‚Äôt recommend this hotel despite its 5-star appearance.

The Titanic Deluxe Lara has some positives, but in my view the negatives outweighed the good. On the positive side, around 80 percent of the staff are excellent. They are friendly, polite, and genuinely eager to help. The food is also very good, with plenty of variety and consistently good quality. Unfortunately, the overall experience does not feel like true five-star luxury, especially when compared with other hotels in Turkey. Rooms are smaller than expected, and even basic items like an iron and ironing board required repeated requests at reception. Service, although well-meaning, is slow. Waiting 20 minutes for drinks at the bar was not unusual, and cocktails were inconsistent. Communication can also be difficult at times because of language barriers. Several aspects were disruptive or unnecessary. Many mornings we were woken by staff loudly restocking minibars along the corridor. On the night before departure we were told to settle our bill by 8pm and even received a reminder phone call, which felt pushy. The hotel is clean overall, but the sunbeds and some communal areas are starting to show their age. The whole property feels a little tired compared with more modern resorts in the area. I may sound critical, but I have stayed in many excellent hotels across Turkey, and this one does not compare well with its competitors. I would urge travellers looking for a true luxury experience to consider newer hotels in the Lara region where real five-star service and facilities are on offer.

Before we arrived, my husband requested a free room upgrade and we did receive one, which was a nice touch. The room had two large beds ‚Äî I coslept with my baby in one while my husband slept in the other. A cot was also provided. On arrival, the room had been decorated with wine, a swan towel, and flower petals, which was sweet. Unfortunately, the positives ended there. The cleanliness was very poor. On the first night, we were too tired to complain, but the floor was filthy (my daughter‚Äôs feet turned black from walking on it) and the bathroom had hair all over the floor and walls. The next morning, we requested a deep clean. Even after this, hairs and dirt were still left behind, and we had to complain again before it was done properly. The room itself felt run down and definitely didn‚Äôt match a true 5-star standard ‚Äî a renovation is much needed. Food & Service:
The food was generally nice, with highlights being the pizzas, kebabs (though they ran out quickly), and desserts. However, service was inconsistent and often disappointing. Staff frequently ignored us when we asked for drinks. We drink a lot of water, and while some staff provided large bottles, others refused, insisting they could only give small bottles or cups. Tables and cutlery at the buffet were almost always dirty, and drinks from machines tasted watery or overly syrupy ‚Äî only cans and alcohol (which we don‚Äôt drink) seemed decent. Pool & Entertainment:
The pool area smelled like sewage for three days, which was very off-putting. It also wasn‚Äôt cleaned as often as it should have been. Sunbeds were impossible to get unless you reserved one around 6‚Äì7am. Entertainment, however, was a highlight ‚Äî fun activities during the day and enjoyable shows at night. Kids Club:
The kids club itself is excellent in terms of facilities. There‚Äôs so much for children to do, including a sleeping room and even a little restaurant just for them. Children are given wristbands and staff take parents‚Äô phone numbers so they can contact you if needed. Many parents felt comfortable leaving their children there with staff, which is allowed. However, supervision is not always reliable. On multiple occasions, I saw children left completely unattended when a staff member walked out of the room ‚Äî sometimes leaving the door open. While the wider facilities are secure, this could still allow a child to wander out or, worse, make it possible for someone to walk in and take a child without staff even realising. This is a serious safety issue, and more staff and stricter supervision are urgently needed. Illness & Hygiene Issues:
From 11th September, my 1.5-year-old daughter became ill with vomiting. By the 13th, both my husband and I were also sick, experiencing vomiting, fever, diarrhoea, and muscle aches. At one point I was bedridden. Despite asking for our room to be disinfected after these incidents, vomit stains were still left on the walls and no proper sanitisation was done. The hotel doctor cost ‚Ç¨150 and could only refer guests to the hospital, so it didn‚Äôt feel worthwhile. When we complained, management dismissed our illness as an ‚Äúisolated issue‚Äù and insisted their hygiene standards were high, which is simply untrue. Cutlery, cups, and tables at the buffet were often dirty, public toilets were unclean, and food hygiene was questionable (I was served undercooked chicken once, and buffet cheese sat out in the heat). Staff also did not stop other guests from touching food with their hands. After posting on a Facebook group, I discovered that many other guests had also been sick around the same time ‚Äî so this was far from an isolated case. Extra Costs:
For a hotel already charging premium prices, extras are very expensive. Cabanas cost ‚Ç¨150 per day, and the spa starts at ‚Ç¨100 minimum, which feels excessive given how much guests already pay to stay here. Final Impressions:
On our last day, when checking under the bed before leaving, we found mould on the bed panels. As of writing this on 22nd September, both my baby and I are still unwell. Overall, this hotel is marketed as 5-star, but in reality, it‚Äôs closer to a 4-star with some 5-star amenities. The price is not justified for the experience we had, and cleanliness, hygiene, and child safety standards all need urgent improvement.

üè® First Impressions & Check-In This was our first family holiday with our two little boys, and a special one for me personally, having grown up visiting Turkish all-inclusives. The hotel grounds and entrance were stunning‚Äîimmaculately kept, beautifully designed, and Solaris Square in particular stood out with its gorgeous stonework. Unfortunately, check-in was disappointing. The staff member at the desk was slow and distracted, which made things difficult as we tried to manage two restless toddlers fresh off a 4.5-hour flight. We were simply handed a room key and told to scan a QR code for information. This lack of guidance meant we missed out on discovering some of the hotel‚Äôs facilities. üõèÔ∏è Accommodation
Our room was spacious, clean, and well-equipped. The beds were extremely comfortable, and we all slept well. The balcony door was stiff, which turned out to be a blessing with toddlers around. Bathrobes, slippers, and a good-sized wardrobe were provided, along with a modern TV. üçΩÔ∏è Food & Drink
The food was excellent and catered well to our varied needs‚ÄîI'm a fussy eater, my husband is vegetarian, and one of our toddlers is autistic with ADHD. We all ate very well. Highlights:
Gozleme station: A breakfast favourite, with lovely staff who made us feel welcome despite the language barrier. Spaghetti Bolognese: A hit with our toddler. Turkish night: A personal favourite‚ÄîTurkish cuisine is unbeatable! Italian snack restaurant: Divine fresh pizzas, highly recommended. Kids‚Äô restaurant: Located in the kids club, open from around 12‚Äì6.30pm. A relaxed space where parents can dine without stress. Coffee & Treats:
Schiller Point Coffee: Open 8am‚Äì12pm, a lovely touch. The iced mocha became part of our morning routine. Patisseries: Great for ice cream and waffles in the afternoon. Drinks Service:
We didn‚Äôt drink alcohol, but service was generally good. Some inconsistency with hot drinks‚Äîstaff gave mixed messages about availability. Special mention to Arda and Beyzanur (aka Melanie Laurent) at the main bar for their friendly service. üéâ Entertainment
We didn‚Äôt experience much of the evening entertainment due to our children‚Äôs bedtime, but we did stay up for the Michael Jackson show, which was impressive and well-coordinated. We‚Äôd love to explore more in future when the kids are older. üë∂ Kids Facilities
The Kikoa Kids Club is the standout feature of this hotel. It‚Äôs unlike anything we‚Äôve seen before. Facilities:
Huge dedicated building with indoor soft play (open 9am‚Äìmidnight), Lego room, arts and crafts, gaming room, and shaded outdoor play area. Everything is clean, air-conditioned, and thoughtfully designed. Water available at reception and a kids-only restaurant that made mealtimes stress-free. Evening mini disco at 8.30pm‚Äîour kids loved it, though I missed the usual disco classics! Honestly, the kids club was perfect and made the holiday for us. üíá On-Site Services
Hairdresser: Prices were extremely high‚Äî‚Ç¨45 for a blow dry. I have long, thick hair with extensions, but still found this excessive. Gift Shop & Tattoos: Also overpriced. Photographers: We had a lovely family photoshoot. The team was patient and not pushy, and the photos are a cherished keepsake. üö™ Facilities & Access
Lifts: A major issue. Only five lifts for the entire hotel, which led to long waits and crowding. We were on the 7th floor, so walking wasn‚Äôt an option with two toddlers. Information Access: The QR code system didn‚Äôt work well for us. We missed out on facilities like the beach snack bar and spa because we couldn‚Äôt find them or weren‚Äôt given clear directions. Staff often just referred us back to the QR code, which was frustrating. ü§î Would I Return? Possibly, but only if I got a great deal. The kids club was outstanding and would be the main reason to return. However, the lack of clear information and guidance on arrival really impacted our experience. For a hotel of this standard, a more personal and informative welcome would make a big difference.

Hotels absolutely spot on and the kids club is great for the kids, shows on for the kids at there own private stage area every night, games rooms with multiple ps5s and Xbox‚Äôs, children‚Äôs entertainment is spot on huge area for them. Branded drinks also available, the Ala Carte restaurants are amazing too, the steak restaurant was amazing, got to select your own cut of steak from the counter and cooked at your table on a stone. Rooms were tidy and clean. Pool area for the adults at Olympic swimming pool absolutely spot on. Kids pool slides and area fantastic and all clean and well looked after. The Italian restaurant was amazing on the way down to the beach. The main buffet restaurant was also spot on huge selections of food. ( although can get very busy) Would I come back yes without a doubt.

We had a wonderful family holiday. Check in could have been better. It seemed to take for ever. A welcome drink would be nice and no information was given upon check in. The rooms were lovely and clean. There was everything you needed and more. The beds were very comfortable. The food was incredible. There were 6 of us. Always a table too, different cuisines and meats every day. The pools were clean and the staff were lovely. We ate in the Italian restaurant and the service was 11/10. A couple of things which were NOT good. The floors at the  pools are treacherous. We saw people fall and slip daily. My daughter saw a lady knock herself out cold. The towel situation is ridiculous! If you dont get up early there are no poolside beds. My daughter got up one morning at 6 30 am so we could have good views and they removed all our towels. In my opion obviously you can't put them out at night but if you make the effort to get of bed early then you deserve the best sun loungers. First come first serve. The problem is the towel removel is very inconsistent. They removed ours but not others! I then had to search for them. They were wet in a pile on the floor. The sea cabana was lovely. Aziz was on the ball. I would recommend that. All the staff work hard and do an incredible job. The coffee was divine in the coffee hut. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Hopefully the managers will rethink the towel situation and the very slippery poolside. There is so much to do. My 19 year old twins did SUP exercises, my daughter ( 11 ) did waterpolo and football. My 10 year old made squishy and had her face painted. My husband played volleyball. The spa was fantastic üëå. So many positive things. The entertainment was very good.

First impressions of Titanic Lara Beach Hotel are good thanks to its excellent location and impressive grounds, but unfortunately the stay itself was disappointing. The rooms felt old and tired, with broken tiles and visible wear that didn‚Äôt match the hotel‚Äôs 5-star image. The food was another letdown ‚Äî the buffet was very repetitive, serving almost the same dishes every day. Although the booking was all-inclusive, we were surprised to find extra charges for the other restaurants, which felt misleading. Service in the restaurants was also poor. Dirty plates were often left on the tables and rarely cleared away. Communication was difficult, as most staff did not speak English or French, making even simple requests frustrating. The hotel felt overcrowded, and there were far too few staff to cope with the demand. I genuinely felt sorry for the staff, as they were clearly working hard but overstretched. Facilities were also below standard. None of the jacuzzis were working during our stay, which was very disappointing. Overall, while the location and appearance of Titanic Lara Beach Hotel are strong, the experience was let down by outdated rooms, repetitive food, poor service, overcrowding, and facilities that failed to live up to expectations.

We‚Äôve just returned from a fantastic family holiday at Titanic Deluxe Lara, and overall, we were truly impressed. The hotel grounds and swimming pools are immaculate, and our room was spacious, comfortable, and cleaned daily. Everything felt spotless and well looked after. The staff were incredibly friendly and genuinely helpful, always ready with a smile and happy to assist with anything we needed. A special mention goes to Hussain from the cabana team, who was absolutely brilliant ‚Äì he made us feel incredibly welcome from the moment we arrived and looked after us throughout the entire stay. His attention to detail and kindness really made a difference to our experience. We‚Äôve actually already booked to return next year, and we honestly can‚Äôt wait! The food could have been slightly better in terms of flavour and variety, but that‚Äôs partly down to our fussy toddler ‚Äì we often face the same issue wherever we go. There‚Äôs still plenty of choice, so most guests should have no problem finding something they enjoy. One tip: don‚Äôt wait for the waiters ‚Äì you‚Äôll be waiting a while. Just go to the bar yourself and you‚Äôll save a lot of time. Sunbeds are definitely an issue ‚Äì especially ones with parasols. After trying two mornings in a row with no luck, we booked a cabana for the rest of our stay, which was honestly a lifesaver with a toddler. However, they could use a little love ‚Äì a lick of paint and new fridges would go a long way. We did have one hiccup where our cabana was double booked, but the cabana team handled it amazingly. They offered us an upgrade to a pier cabana with a jacuzzi at the same price, which was a really kind gesture ‚Äì we declined only because our daughter couldn‚Äôt be in full sun all day. The situation was resolved smoothly when another guest kindly agreed to swap. Unfortunately, Guest Relations turned up late to the party and added zero value. When I explained why we couldn‚Äôt move to the pier, he responded with ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs wrong with her?‚Äù ‚Äì which was neither professional nor appropriate. Let‚Äôs just say I politely asked him to leave. Honestly, he was about as helpful as a lifeguard at a puddle. The entertainment was decent, but often split between the outdoor stage and the amphitheatre, which means you might find yourself doing a bit of back-and-forth if you want to catch everything. Not a huge deal, just something to know. Breakfast and dinner times can be very chaotic ‚Äì lots of families, lots of noise, and children running freely. If you prefer a calmer meal, try going a bit earlier or later to avoid peak madness. ‚Ä¢	Bring euros, not lira ‚Äì everything is priced in euros, and staff clearly prefer them. ‚Ä¢	Tipping is not expected, but it‚Äôs definitely appreciated ‚Äì and the service deserves it. ‚Ä¢	There‚Äôs a great shopping centre 10 minutes away with loads of options for both kids and adults ‚Äì perfect if you fancy a break from the resort. ‚Ä¢	The on-site market is the only major letdown ‚Äì hugely overpriced and not in line with the quality of the rest of the hotel. ‚Ä¢	Oh, and one more thing: if you‚Äôre excited about using the big slides, just brace yourself ‚Äì the slide tower smells like fresh urine. So by all means, knock yourself out if that‚Äôs your thing. Despite a few small bumps, we had a brilliant time. The positives massively outweigh the negatives, and the team, especially people like Hussain, made us feel so welcome and looked after. We‚Äôre already counting down the days to next year‚Äôs return ‚Äì and we‚Äôre hoping for the same great experience (and hopefully a fresh fridge in the cabana üòÑ). Highly recommended for a fun, family-friendly holiday!

I would love to give this hotel the full 5 stars as the food was brilliant to the point we didn‚Äôt even use our a-la-cart voucher we got given on arrival. The staff for the pool, bar, cleaning and kids areas were great. The thing that let this hotel down is where you would had thought they would had exceeded most, the part you paid extra for - on one of our days we paid ¬£175 to have a cabana on the pier which comes with our own server who sorts you out whatever drinks and food you would like from 9:30 am to 5:30pm. At around 2 the server who was doing a great job had to leave but from that point on no one was then allocated our cabana so we stopped getting the service that we had. I did bring it up but nothing was done so most of the time we were getting up and going to the bar ourselves. I would also like to mention for anyone who is thinking or is going to this hotel to avoid the hair salon within the hotel on -1 floor. We had our daughter‚Äôs hair done there on an agreed price. Once completed they tried to charge a different fee, when I questioned it the guy became extremely aggressive even with me holding my 6 month old baby saying if I don‚Äôt pay he will bring my daughter back in and rip it out from her hair. I decided to pay a bit more so that I could leave and not scare my kids any more than they were. I reported this to the hotel who again done nothing only to say they are not really part of the hotel. Yet they do their business within it. Other than these 2 experiences  it was a great holiday

We recently stayed at Titanic Deluxe Lara and while the hotel itself is undeniably beautiful‚Äîwith well-maintained grounds, a lively atmosphere, and solid amenities‚Äîit didn‚Äôt quite live up to the price tag. The rooms were comfortable and the beach access was a definite highlight. The entertainment options were varied and fun, especially for families. Staff were generally helpful, and the location near the airport and local shops was convenient. That said, for what we paid, we expected more. There are several nearby resorts offering similar or even better facilities at more reasonable rates. The value for money just wasn‚Äôt there, especially when compared to other all-inclusive options in the area. Dining was good, but not exceptional, and some services felt a bit stretched during peak times. Overall, it‚Äôs a good hotel‚Äîbut if you're looking for top-tier luxury or exceptional value, you might want to explore other resorts in Lara.

I wouldn‚Äôt say this is a 5* hotel, more like a very good 4*. Firstly, the positives:
Plenty of options for breakfast and dinner, and generally very decent. As anywhere, of course, it‚Äôs a bit repetitive; however, I always found something to tickle my fancy, and my husband, on the other hand, struggled not to overeat with the options available. Lunches in the two restaurants by the beach were by far 11/10! The wraps and pizza were to die for. Desserts were also always a huge hit; my only gripe was that the desserts were too big, so it was hard to try lots of options, and ice cream was delicious. Drinks were always a hit; cocktails are some of the best I‚Äôve ever had at an all-inclusive and were always tasty. The pool was fun; we always went there in the late afternoon when people were leaving, as that‚Äôs when we managed to get a decent sunbed. We discovered the best place for us to chill was on the pier at the end, in the middle, where there are sunbeds right next to the bar. We never bothered booking a cabana as we didn‚Äôt feel the need to. The breeze on the pier was always so welcome. The entertainment was good; we enjoyed ourselves at the white party. We also played pool and went bowling, which was never a problem booking. It was a nice touch being part of the hotel and not having to pay extra for it. The bar here was always so good, and the d√©cor was lovely. We also booked the spa on our last day and paid ‚Ç¨220 for me and my husband to have a Turkish bath (30 mins) and massage (50 mins), which was really good. Now, the negatives are that it‚Äôs mainly about the bedroom. The d√©cor is outdated, but the biggest problem was the smell of cigarettes in the room. I did complain about this when guest services called the next morning and said they would fix it, which they said they did. How I don‚Äôt know because it still smelt the same, and nor did they move us to another room. It did, however, have good toiletries and a minibar. Another issue we had was that the electricity went twice in one day, and the second time it took almost an hour to resolve. Not quite what you expect from a 5* hotel. The last thing was that they disabled the room key the night before. We had got to the room to find both keys disabled and had to go to reception for them to say you have to settle your bill today, which is stupid as your money is in your room, which they‚Äôve now blocked you out of. I don‚Äôt understand why this cannot be done on the day of checkout, like what normal hotels do, especially a 5*. Overall, we actually had an amazing time despite the niggles. Would I recommend it? Yes, would I return no more because we always like to try somewhere new. There are definitely things the hotel can work on.

Just returned from a 10 night stay at the Titanic, there was 14 of us ranging in age from 2-56. The hotel looks very grand and check in was easy, polite staff and our cases were taken to our rooms which is always a nice touch. The rooms are smaller than other 5* we have been to but do come with a mini bar, flat screen tv and Air Con(I‚Äôll come back to that shortly) and the bed was nice and comfy. The pool areas are nice, kids pool and slides is great and there are bigger, quieter pools for those with no children. The floors around the pools are VERY slippy, very dangerous and we saw countless people falling. You can order drinks using the QR codes on the umbrella and your drinks come via ‚Äúskater waiters‚Äù which is good, they work hard. Service at the bar is also good although drinks often come different each time depending on who serves you. We found the food ok, we ate most nights without issue but some of our party struggled and decided to either eat out or use the al la carte restaurants, they said the Asian was very nice but the Italian/greek were average. We found sitting in the 16+ area was much better, you can find a table to eat at easier and your drinks are served quicker,  but obviously those with younger children have to struggle amongst the crowds. Guests don‚Äôt help, lots of rude people pushing in or taking all the freshly cooked steaks! There‚Äôs a lack of toilets in the main buffet restaurant, if you are sat at the bottom and your child needs to go quickly you have to make your way all the way to the top entrance. Food in the other snack bars is decent although due to language barriers service is sometimes a struggle. Potato bar, waffle and ice cream bar both great, good selection. Kids area is great, large safe area for kids of all ages, we didn‚Äôt leave the children but I do think it would be safe too. Beach is good, always lots of loungers and the sea is lovely, again a toilet block would be handy but only a suggestion. On site shops are ok, we only bought bits and as expected it‚Äôs a little more expensive than heading to the other shops a short walk away. Once you get around the place you start to notice that the hotel is in need of a make over, cracked marble counters just fixed with sealant. Our bathroom ceiling needed a re-paint and our air conditioning decided each day if it wanted to work or not and we noticed a glass left near a lift for about 4/5 days running. Small things really that didn‚Äôt spoil our stay but for a 5* at the cost we paid it would put us off returning I‚Äôm afraid. There were issues that the hotel has little control over, some of the guest were just plain rude, running up and down corridors at 3am, slamming doors at all hours. It‚Äôs a shame but certainly not the Titanics fault. My main moan was an isolated incident where I ordered a round of drinks at a bar by the first pool, it was around 23:45 and I‚Äôd waited in line. The moment it turned 00:00 I was refused part of my order as the bar had closed! Ridiculous and very embarrassing for me returning with less drinks than required. I wouldn‚Äôt expect this anywhere let alone a 5* hotel having paid over ¬£6000. We found the entertainment average, they try and it can‚Äôt be easy in the heat but it‚Äôs all things you‚Äôve seen before and the seating area looks much larger on pictures. We did a boat trip which was great, staff were very good and we went to caves and waterfalls, would recommend this. Some also used jet skis which the kids enjoyed but it was expensive. The Dolphin swim a short walk away from the hotel was very expensive and not very well organised. On the whole we enjoyed our holiday, the Titanic is not a bad hotel it just needs an upgrade, we would return to Turkey but would probably return to the Trendy Lara a short distance away.

Great holiday but Unfortunately not a 5* Sorry for the long post. This is our 9th visit to lara beach but first time at titanic. We've always heard good things about the hotel in the past and firends have stayed here before so thought we would book as a last minute holiday. We travelled as 2 adults and 2 children. When we arrived we checked in and went to the room then went straight down to watch the fireworks. When we went back to the room our key cards didnt work. Bit of an inconvenience but quickly sorted. The rooms are fine as not alot of time spent in them, the pull out bed for our 11 year old and 8 year old was very small. The pillows are awful. Well stocked mini bar every day and was cleaned everyday with fresh towels. The morning breakfast doesn't start until 8am which I thought was a bit late as normally opens at 7am. Breakfast was nice enough but the pastrys were always a bit on the burnt side and stuck to the baking tray. Long que for omlettes. The sunbed situation at this hotel is a dampener on anyone's holiday! Its a joke and alot of sunbeds are reserved very early. We saw the towel police come round and remove towels which obviously caused a few arguments between the guests that originally put their towels down as they were not aware that they had been removed and thought people had just stole there sunbeds. Maybe they need to follow the Sunbed policy from other hotels like the delphins. The slides are excellent and the pools are lovely, clean and  refreshing. The Olympic pool we food too warm and hardly used it. The inside pool is freezing. The floors are deadly. We saw so many kids and adults fall over. I think they would benefit from some mats for people to walk on. Skaters Yousef and mustafa are the best and so friendly and helpful they couldn't do enough for you. A big thank you to osman the cleaner around the pool. He's a lovely guy, so friendly and is brilliant at keeping the areas clean. I bet he doesn't get enough praise from the management for what he does. The bars around the pool do not open until 10am. I think we occasionally could get bottled water but this is ridiculous seeing as people go down to the pool about 7 or 8. This is where the fridges would come in handy. The drinks are a disappointment for a 5* hotel. All the other hotels we have been to along lara beach have had fridges with bottles of water, cans of soft drinks, bottles beer etc that you can help yourself to. I think they would definitely benefit from the fridges throught the pool areas and hotel as it would take pressure off the waiters, bar areas nad prevent ques. This also applies to branded ice cream. This was a big disappointment as only scoop ice cream available unless you go to the kids club and they only offer a few random wrapped ice creams the freezer. Again this is the first hotel we have been to in lara beach that don't have the freezers to help yourself. The lunch restaurants down the beach are lovely. We never had a bad lunch in either of these, good choice and we always managed to find a seat. The service was really quick. I think the hotel needs a few snack areas with quick food as not everyone wants to go in the buffet for lunch or the two restaurants. After breakfast finishes there is nothing to snack on until the lunch opens. After lunch theres only waffles, Ice cream, fruit and jacket potatoes available until dinner. The Cabanas on the pier are brilliant, we booked this for my husbands birthday and enjoyed it so much we booked again during the week. They are expensive considering everything you get is available within the hotel but nice to have the waiter service and also the shade and breeze from the beach. We booked Cabana number 1 both times as we felt more comfortable with the kids being able to go down the stairs into the sea as it is deep. The guy we booked with at the beach Cabana reception was brilliant and so helpful (sorry I can't remember his name) We didnt try any of the al a carte restaurants which were extra. Again the other hotels we have stayed in allowed guests one visit per stay for free. The late restaurant after 11pm was good. We only visited here once for a quick snack and a good variety on the menu. The hotel was full and you could definitely notice this. We felt there were too many cabanas round the pool and if these were removed you could fit in many more single sunbeds. The hotel is very cramped with the amount if people and there are never any areas that feel less busy. I would say 90% are English guests which we have never really had at any of the other hotels. It was nice as we were able to speak to alot of other guests and hear there experiences. Alot have said the same as us. Also the English know how to que which is a good thing when it comes to the lifts. After being at the pool you had some randoms that do not understand that there is a que and push in. They were soon put in their place and sent to the back of the que by the English guests. The entertainment the first few days we were there was not brilliant. Towards the middle/end of the hotel it definitely got better. The titanic fest was brilliant and the kids loved it. It was very busy and I think the staff need to monitor the games etc as it was just a free for all with some kids not with their parents and just didnt want to get off when it was someone else's turn. The show on the Thursdsy night with the motorbikes (can't remember what it was called) was great. Everyone loved it and it was the best show we had seen. The food in the evening buffet was really nice. There was something for everyone. It was chaotic in the restaurant as no one wanted to sit outside in the heat to eat so everyone was trying to find tables inside. There was a few times we had to wait but the waiters were normally good at cleaning tables quickly. The kids club is probably the best we have seen. Our kids are a bit older but went in the soft play occasionally with some friends they met. Its lovely and cool in there. Some of the staff on the reception in the kids club were a bit miserable and didnt seem to want to be there. Others were lovely and made the kids feel very welcome. The hotel is in a good location and only a 5/10 min walk to the shops. When it came to checking out the man on reception asked if we was checking out which I said yes. All he said was room number, checked the system and asked for our room keys. No mention of "did you have a nice holiday, was everything ok" very miserable. We have had a great holiday. We had friends meet us out there half way through the holiday (they are still there) and met some lovely people that we will keep in touch with. Would we stay again? If it came up cheaper than some of the other hotels then maybe yes. This hotel is quite expensive compared to some other hotels we have been to and I wouldn't say the experiance was any better. I have mentioned another hotel chain previously and I think we always compare hotels to these as the experiance there was more than 5*. Titanic really needs to make some improvements and if these are made we would return. Overall we've had a great holiday, we don't regret booking this hotel and glad we had the experiance. We are just a bit disappointed to have paid the amount we did and was expecting more. A big thank you to yousef and mustafa the skaters round the pool and especially osman the cleaner by the pool. You were all amazing and definitely a credit to the hotel.

Das Hotel ist top. die Strand Cabana sind super das Essen ist super das Personal ist super. Am meisten bevorzuge ist Herr Ergin von The Gastrelation und Herr ja Ahmet von der Strand, Cabarna und Emre von der Rezeption.

We recently stayed at the Titanic Hotel for a week as a family with children aged 5, 14, and 17. Overall, it‚Äôs a large, clean, hotel with plenty of activities for all ages, which is a definite plus. The kids‚Äô club was especially good while I didn‚Äôt leave my 5-year-old there unattended, we both enjoyed a daily visit, and the staff were welcoming and engaging. That said, there were a few disappointments, mainly around the √† la carte restaurants, which come at an extra cost. We tried a few of them: ‚Ä¢	The Italian Restaurant had a pleasant atmosphere and the food was decent, though the menu was quite limited. ‚Ä¢	The Greek Night offered great entertainment and a fun vibe, but unfortunately, the food didn‚Äôt meet expectations. ‚Ä¢	The Beef Restaurant was another miss in terms of variety, and while we ordered T-bone steaks, they arrived without any seasoning still edible, but lacking flavour. A particular issue we had involved our 5-year-old‚Äôs meal. We ordered just chicken nuggets and chips, but the dish came with spring rolls and other sides we said we didn't want. When I told the waiter we didn‚Äôt order those extras, he insisted that‚Äôs just how the meal comes. Eventually, he returned with only three nuggets and a plate of chips. I let it go at the time, but the next morning I spoke with hotel management not to dispute the cost, but to raise the principle of being charged ‚Ç¨25 for such a basic kids meal. Unfortunately, the manager was not flexible and insisted we pay the full amount. One final note: my teenage son mentioned that a staff member offered to fill in a positive review on his phone on his behalf, and even took a photo of his screen after posting it. This felt uncomfortable and raised concerns about how reviews might be managed to balance out negative feedback. Overall, the hotel shows promise and offers several positives, particularly for families. However, there are areas that require improvement most notably in guest services and the value and quality of food provided in the √† la carte dining experience.

Leaving today after ten days here , thought I would note the following which may help Pros:- 
Patisserie is amazing , unlimited cakes and ice creams etc which kept the kids (and adults) happy ! The buffet food is nice and definitly something for everyone but it is so busy and chaotic. Due to this it isn‚Äôt as clean around the dining areas as it should be and didn‚Äôt feel like a 5 star hotel. Smoking around the kids pool - I get it‚Äôs a habit for some but smoking around my kids wasn‚Äôt something I appreciated , blowing smoke over to us (not by the English guests, mainly European guests) A la Cartes are expensive to attend compared to other holidays - they are brilliant and staff are incre√≠ble but I feel this could be offered at a lower price considering how much we paid to come on holiday. There needs to be more options to experience more a la Carte places in my opinion for example the Trendy hotel offers all a la Cartes at least once for free Lifts - there needs to be many more lifts , we were lucky we were on floor one so only had two flights of stairs up and down to the pool but if you are on higher floors I can imagine it to be an annoyance and waiting for the lifts can be long On site shops - very expensive ! Go for a 5 minute walk outside the hotel and there are a lot of shops for much cheaper Games room - very old outdated equipment , needs to be updated as half the machines didn‚Äôt work. Not a lot of variety there. There is only 1 pool table in the entire hotel which with the amount of guests around made it impossible to have a go. The locals usually take it up for long periods. Rooms - the walls are very thin, we heard everything from next door for our entire trip - why people decide to re organise the room at 3 am I will never know but it made for an unsettled experience Food is plentiful and tasty I enjoyed every meal. The entertainment staff are amazing and so so talented the shows were brilliant and a real treat The cabana is a must we had one on the pier (cabana 4) and loved it. It was a great day only downside was the staff weren‚Äôt around for drink orders as much as I‚Äôd have hoped The steak a la carte is a must do experience the food was amazing and the service and atmosphere even better Overall I wouldn‚Äôt come back and would try another hotel , it definitely was a great holiday but too many negatives for us to pay the money to come back. We paid ¬£4500 for the holiday plus about ¬£600 in spends for 2 adults 1 child so for that , I would have expected a little more

- There was an awful smell around some of the free cabanas on the grass every single day. - We flew at 11pm so we paid the 30‚Ç¨ p/h for a room.. was taken down a dingey corridor in this small smelly room with rubbish air con and the windows didn‚Äôt open. We had ants under the wardrobe.
