We stayed at the Titanic Deluxe Lara in August for our summer holiday. As many people will know, this is not a cheap hotel, so we arrived with fairly high expectations. First Impressions
The hotel certainly delivers on arrival ‚Äì the reception area looks stunning, and the signature scents in the lobby create a luxury feel. We arrived at 2am and really appreciated the 24-hour snack bar, which meant we could grab a drink and a light bite before heading to bed. Pools & Sunbeds
The pool areas and water slides are a big highlight, especially for families. We‚Äôd heard stories of people reserving loungers from 5am, but in truth, we never struggled to find sunbeds. One drawback is how slippery the pool areas are ‚Äì we saw a number of people fall (including waiters carrying trays of glasses), and unfortunately some quite nasty accidents. Food & Drink
The drinks offering is excellent, with proper branded options that you don‚Äôt always see in all-inclusive hotels. Fresh fruit, waffles, and snacks are plentiful throughout the day. The buffet restaurant serves good quality food, though it does become repetitive over a two-week stay. The √† la carte restaurants come at an extra cost unless you book through Jet2, and while the food is nice, the menus are very limited. For example, the steakhouse only serves steak, which left my wife (a non-steak eater) with no option other than ordering separately from the Italian. Service & Cleanliness
Service in the main buffet restaurant was disappointing ‚Äì tables were often left uncleared for long periods, drinks service was slow, and on several occasions we had to wait 10 minutes or more for a table to be wiped before we could sit down. Cleanliness overall is fine, but not at the standard you‚Äôd expect of a 5* hotel. Some areas would benefit from modernisation and a general refresh. Kids Club
On the positive side, the kids club is by far the best we have ever seen. It is extremely safe and offers unique activities such as music rooms, arts and crafts, and even t-shirt making. For families with children, this is a real standout feature. Entertainment
Evening entertainment was a mixed bag. Many of the shows felt repetitive, with dance groups performing the same routines. The Michael Jackson tribute was excellent, but overall, more variety is needed. The live bands in the main square were enjoyable but far too loud ‚Äì it was difficult to relax or chat, and if your room overlooks the square, you‚Äôll struggle to sleep before midnight. ‚Ä¢	The coffee shop is a great touch, serving excellent drinks and cakes, though it only stays open until midday ‚Äì it would be even better if it ran later into the afternoon. ‚Ä¢	The scuba diving team were brilliant, very professional and helpful. ‚Ä¢	The poolside towel lady is one of the friendliest and most smiley people we‚Äôve ever met ‚Äì she really stood out, and we‚Äôd encourage guests to tip her well. ‚Ä¢	The private cabanas are nice, though they need some attention. Avoid Cabana 9 by the pool ‚Äì the constant banging of the rope made it anything but relaxing. Overall
Titanic Deluxe Lara is a good hotel with plenty of positives, but it doesn‚Äôt quite justify the price we paid. With stronger service, more variety in food and entertainment, and some upgrades to facilities, it could be excellent. For us, hotels such as Delphin Palace currently offer better overall value in Lara.

So as I write this I am in the airport waiting to go home, whilst everything is fresh in my mind. Just to preface, we are a family of 4 (2 boys, 10&6) who came for 11 nights in the hight of summer and it cost us ¬£5,800. Prior to travelling, everyone who I spoke to put this place on a pedestal and raved about how this was the best place they've ever been to, so expectations were made. To breakdown our experience; The room was very clean and tidy, small but enough space. I wasn't personally keen on the configuration, making the boys share a double bed. I did t say anything to the front desk and we made it work. The first two nights we left it as it was and the boys actually fell out of bed. I pushed the bed against the bathroom wall and put the boys pillows against the wall amazing a wider bed. Our bed was exactly the same and found the bed a bit firm and small for us, the pillows were poor, as a result our sleep wasn't great. Id say 4/5 for room as I didn't actually complain about it to the staff. Pools were absolutely fine, I have no issues with the outdoor pools. The ocean pool was where we spent the majority of our time as it wasn't too deep for our kids. We spent some time in the Olympic pool too again it was absolutely fine, same as ocean but just deeper. There was always beds within the first 2 rows around the olympic pool, the sunbeds weren't a problem here. We tried the indoor pool one day just so we had tried it, it was freezing and the jacuzzi didn't work. Score wise for the outdoor pools 5/5. Indoor pool 1/5 (but you probably won't want this on a summer holiday) Coming from a coastal town, we aren't interested in the beach really. Looking down the beach, it was clear, clean and spacious. The actual sand space isn't a lot as it's mainly shilly once you get away from the waters edge. We aren't beach lovers but would score it a 4/5. We're fortunate enough to be able to afford a pool cabanna 8 out of our 11 days. Can't lie, at ‚Ç¨1200, it was expensive and on the whole, it was 100% worth it, you can have a lie in and not do sunbed wars, have drinks and food brought to you and you have a mini fridge on tap. However on our first day, we were in Cabanna 9 and a Turkish family tried to sit between cabannas 9 and 10. When I tried explaining that the two families in these cabannas had paid ‚Ç¨300 combined for this area, they got very aggressive and tried to start a fight. When I called the Cabanna manager on the day (Sunday) he spent ages talking to the man and tried to money him. Eventually they actually gave them a Cabanna for free for that afternoon. Even after that, they tried to come back and cause more trouble. I tried to complain to guest relations and I was told "it's a guest issue" and nothing to do with the hotel and they would not even compensate me for the troubles. However when the usual manager, H√ºseyin, returned on the Monday (He worked Monday to Saturday) it experience was brilliant. That first Sunday was a 1/5. After that it was 5/5 well worth it. The entertainment had potential, however there was far too many gaps for interpretative dance. The dancing was poor. My boys got very bored, very quick. The separated kids entertainment and adults entertainment was a low light for me. I enjoy watching the kids make a fool of themselves before the main attraction. Even being sat in Solaris Square, the bands and singers were too loud, you couldn't have a chilled conversation with friends. You were constantly shouting. Daytime entertainment isn't very well advertised however I enjoyed the water polo and the football. A fair rating of this is about 2/5. As to be expected whenever you visit Turkey, there is no bacon. This being said, once you expect it, you get over it. What was poor was the selection, it was the same items for breakfast and dinner, evening meal was on a 3 day rotation. Breakfast was fine there, however I got very fed up of the same items and by days 9, 10 and 11 I resorted to cereal for a change. That was even poor as there was no cold milk. So dinner was a funny one as we did not try the main resteraunt and stuck to the two main cuisines by the beach. The grill and the Italian were very nice and I'd recommend those. The waffle stand and the ice creams were stand out by far, particularly for our children. They recommend a waffle with chocolate sauce, chocolate chips and strawberrys. As stated very repetitive. However as steak lovers, me and my eldest loved every 3rd day when they grilled steaks. All cakes were delicious and we had no issues finding something we liked. We ALL enjoyed the slides, whilst the novelty was there, for the first two days we were doing the bigger slides. We created a game of 'who can soak the second row of sun loungers infront'. That is also a big tip. Don't sit on the first row of sun loungers unfront of the big slides. Both my children needed a wristband where I needed to sign a waiver, a fact I don't mind but I don't see the point for the older children, the water isn't that deep. Pirate island is mainly for little children and my youngest really seemed to enjoy it. Being honest after the first 3 days, my children weren't phased by it but it was good to go and spend half an hour here and there. The hotel itself was large and clean with lots of staff. The hotel shops are very costly and I would avoid at all times. The walk up to the blue bridge and the shops further down the strip will save you a minimum of 50% before haggling. After the entertainment, you will be waiting a minimum of 20 minutes just for a lift to your floor. The lifts are terrible. Every single day there is lifts going to floors but they're too full to get in. Be prepared to hit every floor on your way to breakfast/pool/meals or even back to your room. Also don't expect any decorum from the Turkish Nationals or the former Soviets, they are absolutely rude and will push into you, jump the ques and even blatantly stare at you while they do it. Being fair all the points I've raised didn't spoil our holiday. I just can't understand why people put this hotel on the pedestal when there are so many hotels in Lara beach. I would advise to try the delphin imperial as it looks much bigger and the splash park looks better (we seen this from a boat trip, we were able to see all the hotels on the strip.) I believe a 3/5 is very fair as it wasn't a bad holiday, but I wouldn't return.

We as a family of 9 have just returned from the Titanic for the second time. The first time was last year and we were so impressed we returned this year. However, we won‚Äôt be returning as the hotel has deteriorated over the past 12 months. Massive complex, incredibly spacious hotel with plenty of open spaces and really nice grounds. Pools are huge and the water slides are really good. The all inclusive drinks are branded and imported. Snacks being available pretty much all day. Beach cabana‚Äôs are amazing. Had a couple days on them and it was worth it. Cabana waiters and the odd bar waiter are really good and work hard. However, the majority just can‚Äôt be bothered and don‚Äôt seem interested. The pool areas are treacherous when wet. My mother slipped upon getting there and walking to the room. We also witnessed multiple people slipping almost on an hourly basis, with one lady requiring a hospital visit and CT Scan. Guest relations informed us that they put out wet floor signs!!!! I‚Äôm sorry, that is a warning, it‚Äôs not addressing the very dangerous problem. The pool cabana‚Äôs are not worth the cost. They are the same price as the beach cabanas. The pool ones are smaller, require maintenance and ours was infested with ants after moving a pillow. Food had not been cleaned up from the previous day. Guest relations did not believe us and claimed we had dropped food. Staff, most are not interested. The room we had, family block was dirty and the floors were never cleaned. It would turn white socks black and if you didn‚Äôt wear the provided slippers, your bare feet would be black too. Food and food hygiene, this was nowhere near as good as last year. We all had stomach issues with one of us having mild food poisoning for 3 days after visiting the Italian a la carte. It was either a DJ playing awful, repetitive house music (ghostbusters remix I kid you not) or a poor show in the amphitheater. The MJ show was good but that was all. The Temu version of The Little Mermaid was horrendous. It was more suited to 5 years olds than families. They don‚Äôt take our feedback seriously and accused us of fabricating some of the issues as we don‚Äôt bring any of it up earlier in our holiday. The reply to this review will be interesting, as they do not like negative feedback. If you place your own towels out before 7am and leave, they will be removed by pool staff. If you place the hotel supplies towels before 8am and leave, they will be removed. However, if you speak Turkish, and tip the pool staff, they will place your towels out for you early in the morning. This caused a major uproar one morning, as the British families did not stand for this and removed them!! On the whole, we had a good holiday with the family, but I would not return to the Titanic again. It‚Äôs not a patch on last year.

We‚Äôve stayed at other Titanic hotels before and always had great experiences, but this visit to Titanic Deluxe Lara was really disappointing. So disappointed with our stay. We had read so many great reviews about this hotel and were really looking forward to our stay. Like everyone, we have worked hard all year to pay for this holiday and have been so underwhelmed. Firstly - the rooms. Very dated and in need of a revamp. There isn‚Äôt a great deal of storage space for belongings. Hair dryer is dated. No iron in room which is an inconvenience. The shower drains clearly weren‚Äôt cleaned or cleared before our stay as the first time we had a shower it was overfilling. We really didn‚Äôt feel the rooms were immaculately clean. Our bedding was also stained on arrival and when reporting it to reception, although fresh linen was sent up, there was no apology, nor did they offer to make the bed up for us. We were simply handed the bed linen. Not really 5* treatment if you ask me. Secondly - the food. As a party of 10, there wasn‚Äôt one adult that was overly satisfied. The main restaurant was SO repetitive and the food was very poor. There doesn‚Äôt seem to be themed nights like there are in most all inclusive hotels, so I don‚Äôt think this helped the variation. I totally appreciate that food in all inclusive resorts will get a bit samey after a week, but it seemed that it was the same dishes for lunch and dinner with very little change. The other issue is that no member of staff shows you to a table, so when you go to the restaurant at peak times it can be impossible to find a table. Furthermore, we would often be sitting for a length of time before we could flag down a waitress to ask for drinks and cutlery. The main dining area had no atmosphere and was more like a big canteen. It just wasn‚Äôt a nice experience. Seating and walls were in need of touch ups. This is the first hotel I‚Äôve been to that I‚Äôve actually dreaded going to eat. We did eat in the Italian Al A Carte which was slightly better and the service was much better there. That brings me to my next point, the staff. We have not had a great experience with the staff in this hotel. The majority of them pass you without even acknowledging you, never mind saying ‚Äúhello‚Äù or ‚Äúgood morning‚Äù. We found most staff extremely rude and unbothered - particularly in the main restaurant. When we raised these issues with guest relations we genuinely didn‚Äôt feel they cared and no compensation was offered. My partner pushed for a complementary Al A carte which was then agreed. We will not return and I do not recommend.

We are on our last day at the Titanic Deluxe Lara, travelling as a large party of 17. Overall, we had a great holiday and found many aspects of the hotel to be excellent. The hotel staff were accommodating, ensuring our rooms were close together and on the same floor. Rooms were clean, tidy, well-equipped with nice toiletries, and stocked minibars. There are four main pools, all of which were lovely, although securing a sunbed required early starts. By 7am most loungers were already ‚Äúreserved‚Äù with towels. on one occasion we saw guests putting towels out at 2am. Perhaps the hotel could consider adding more sunbeds to ease this. The numerous beach bars serving ice cream, fruit, and drinks were a great addition, with service always friendly and efficient. We booked a pier cabana for several days, the staff there were outstanding, keeping drinks and food flowing all day. The beach itself was fine, though the sea was murkier than expected, not the hotel‚Äôs fault. Dining during the day offered good variety, with Greek and Italian sit-down restaurants as alternatives to the buffet. The buffet, however, was very repetitive; by day three, we had tired of seeing largely the same dishes. The Greek and Italian restaurants (with supplements) were well worth it for a change of menu. Evenings were lively, with nightly shows followed by a disco and nightclub. The entertainment and bar staff were fantastic friendly, attentive, and a credit to the hotel. Complaint ‚Ä¶ Final Night Incident Unfortunately, an incident on our final night left a lasting negative impression. At around 1:45am, I returned to my room to find my key card no longer worked. When I went to reception to have it reactivated, I was told I had an outstanding bill that needed to be paid immediately. I explained that I was happy to settle the bill, but my wallet and cards were in my room. Despite this, the receptionist repeatedly refused to issue me a replacement key unless I paid there and then. I offered for him to come with me to my room so I could retrieve my wallet from the safe and then return to pay, which he initially agreed to. However, after waiting upstairs for 10 minutes, no one arrived. When I returned to reception, I was met with shocking unprofessionalism , the receptionist laughed at me, covered his name badge with his hand when I asked for his name, and flatly refused to give it. When I told him his behaviour was rude, instead of attempting to resolve the situation, he began to argue with me across the reception area as I walked away. He also claimed there was no manager available, despite one being clearly visible nearby. To make matters worse, a young female member of our group experienced the exact same treatment, also being locked out of her room and refused a key. She became visibly upset and cried in front of the staff. I ultimately paid both her bill and mine in cash just to end the ordeal. This behaviour is completely unacceptable, 
Locking paying guests out of their rooms in the early hours is unreasonable, unsafe, and deeply unprofessional. Refusing access to belongings needed to pay the bill is illogical and shows no common sense. Laughing at guests, hiding your name badge to avoid accountability, and arguing instead of resolving the issue is disgraceful customer service. I understand if the hotel requires bills to be settled the day before departure, and I accept that I missed the text reminder. However, the way this was handled was completely wrong and could have been resolved in seconds with a simple apology and agreement to settle the bill first thing in the morning. Sadly, this incident has overshadowed what was otherwise a great week, and because of the way we were treated by the two reception staff, neither I nor the other 17 members of our party would return to this hotel.

I just wanted to share a few things. We are currently staying at the Titantic Lara, it is a lovely hotel, but ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ 
Just a few little niggles that some people might not mind. If you want a sunbed by the pool you need to be an early riser! I got down the pool at 7.30 and could not find a space with a umbrella. If you don‚Äôt mind not having shade there was a few left. I was up early as wanted to reserve/book a cabana on the pier. Cabanas around the pool side and on pier are well over ‚Ç¨100, ones on Pier are between ‚Ç¨300-‚Ç¨175 depending if you want a jacuzzi or not. You do get some perks with the cabanas like a fridge, food and butler service. We are in a junior suite. The rooms are tired and need refurbishment, also for a suite we only have one tiny bathroom between 2 rooms. Long wait if you order pizza from restaurant leading to the beach ! No hot dog / burger/ chips / kebab that you can take back to your Sun loungers like other hotels on Lara beach . However, lots of waffles, ice cream and cake . The air con is really loud in the room! At the moment other than these little issues overall the hotel is good, food is lovely !!
